reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Advocacy for international labour standards, labour law, fundamental principles and rights at work (child labour, forced labour, non-discrimination in the workplace, freedom of association and collective bargaining); formalisation of informal work, occupational safety and health.

This award supports advocacy for international labor standards, labor law, fundamental principles and rights at work. More specifically, this includes Monitoring compliance with labor law and international labor standards in the export apparel sector.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Bureau of International Labor Affairs/Office of Trade and Labor Affairs/Technical Assistance and Cooperation

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S. assistance to Lesotho supports the development of a stable, prosperous, and healthy nation. One of Lesotho's greatest challenges is a severe HIV/AIDS epidemic. U.S. assistance to address the epidemic complements a significant effort by the Government of Lesotho, other donors, and many U.S. nongovernmental organizations and universities. The U.S. government also seeks to enhance the professionalization of Lesotho's military by promoting democratic values. These efforts support the broader U.S. government objective of supporting institutions that help underpin the country's struggling democracy.
Quarterly disbursements by project. May include disbursements for: salary and benefits, travel and per diem, logistical expenses and other costs of delivering technical assistance.

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management
